headline: Intern - Writer / International Writer Advocacy and Impact - Paris
author: Paris, France

Karuna-Shechen recruitment
Intern - Writer / International Writer Advocacy and Impact - Paris - Internship - Communication, Editor - Associations - 05-31-2022

description: Karuna-Shechen is recruiting a "Intern - Writer / International Writer Advocacy and Impact - Paris" - Co-fondée par Matthieu Ricard, Karuna-Shechen agit et plaide pour un monde plus altruiste. L'association agit pour briser le cycle de l’extrême pauvreté en Inde, au Népal et au Tibet.
articleBody:
Fondée par le moine bouddhiste Matthieu Ricard en 2000, Karuna-Shechen agit et plaide pour un monde plus altruiste. En Inde et au Népal, l’association lutte contre l’extrême pauvreté et met en œuvre des projets de solidarité et de développement pour les populations défavorisées, dans les secteurs de la santé, de l'éducation, de la sécurité alimentaire, du développement économique et de la préservation de l’environnement. En 2021, plus de 442 000 personnes ont été accompagnées.

Une équipe de 50 bénévoles et de 160 employés font vivre l’association au quotidien, dont 150 employés locaux dans nos pays d’intervention à Katmandou (Népal), au Jharkhand (Inde) ou au Bihar (Inde). Le reste est réparti en France, Suisse, Etats-Unis et Hong-Kong.

Karuna-Shechen est un vecteur d'altruisme dans le monde etrecherche un stagiaire pour accompagner sa production de contenus inspirants, informatifs et/ou pédagogiques, via des articles, témoignages, reportages vidéos, rapports, newsletters, diffusés sur ses réseaux sociaux et son site internet qui touchent chaque année une communauté de plus de 500 000 personnes.

MISSION

description: Wake up Café Marseille is recruiting a "In charge of insertion Wake up Café - CDI Marseille - Marseille" - Accompagner les personnes détenues et sortant de prison vers une réinsertion durable et sans récidive.
articleBody:
Wake up Café accompagne sans limite de temps, des détenus et ex-détenus (wakeurs) afin de soutenir, via la communauté d’entraide, une réinsertion durable et sans récidive.

Nous intervenons ainsi dès la détention et accompagnons dans nos locaux les sortants de prison porteurs d’une demande sincère d’aide pour se réinsérer et ayant la capacité d’intégrer en toute confiance, un accompagnement collectif.

Nous leur proposons un parcours hebdomadaire axé sur l’emploi le matin et la reconstruction personnelle l’après-midi jusqu’à leur reprise d’activité professionnelle.

Ainsi en lien avec le reste de l'équipe, le ou la chargé(e) d'insertion aura pour missions de :

headline: Alternatiba civic service: Mobilization around territorial alternatives and animation of the network - Grenoble
author: Civic service / VSI

breadcrumbs.name: Positive impact companies and associations that recruit
ALTERNATIBA recruitment
Alternatiba civic service: Mobilization around territorial alternatives and animation of the network - Grenoble - Civic service / VSI - Autres - Ecology - 05-31-2022

description: ALTERNATIBA  is recruiting a "Alternatiba civic service: Mobilization around territorial alternatives and animation of the network - Grenoble" - Alternatiba/ ANV-COP21  est un mouvement populaire pour le climat et la justice sociale qui se constitue d’un réseau de groupes locaux en France et d’autres pays francophones.
articleBody:
Le mouvement Alternatiba :

Alternatiba est un mouvement populaire pour le climat et la justice sociale qui se constitue d’un réseau de groupes locaux en France et d’autres pays francophones. Il sensibilise à l’urgence climatique, rend visible des modes de production et de consommation alternatifs et organise des mobilisations massives pour le climat.

Le nom du projet, de la campagne, la présentation de la commission :

En coopération avec le Réseau Action Climat, Alternatiba mène la campagne Alternatives Territoriales avec l’objectif d’enclencher une métamorphose de nos territoires vers plus de sobriété, de résilience et de justice sociale. Dans ce but, une équipe de coordination nationale constituée de salarié.es et de bénévoles accompagne et forme des groupes locaux Alternatiba au plaidoyer pour des politiques publiques ambitieuses sur le climat.

Lancée en décembre 2017, le projet Alternatives Territoriales regroupe actuellement une cinquantaine de groupes répartis en France, menant des campagnes variées : certains ont fait signé le Pacte de la Transition à leurs élus en amont des élections municipales, d’autres se mobilisent contre des projets d'aménagement ou sur des thématiques précises comme la place de la voiture en ville et la pollution de l’air.

L’enjeu de la séquence 2022-23 : 2023 sera l’année de mi-mandat municipal ; un important travail de préparation de ce temps et de communication doit être pensé.

Participer au suivi et à l’accompagnement des groupes locaux Alternatiba et ANV-COP21 dans leurs activités (campagnes globales ou locales)
Aider au suivi et recensement général de ce que fait notre réseau : mobilisations climat, actions et formations locales, campagnes locales
Participer à la mobilisation et l’information de nos groupes sur nos projets et campagnes : faire des kits, informer via des réunions et des mails, accompagner, répondre aux questions
Aider à la gestion et animation d'outils qui permettent d'animer le réseau et de l'informer (tableaux, réseau social interne, etc.)
Renforcer l’équipe de coordination de la campagne Alternatives Territoriales :
accueillir les nouveaux groupes de travail qui se créent (envoyer un mail type de bienvenue, les appeler pour créer un premier contact, leur donner les informations de base sur la campagne)
suivre les groupes locaux impliqués dans la campagne : contacter les groupes locaux afin de faire remonter les informations sur les avancées des campagnes locales et permettre un partage des expériences
participer à la création et à la mise à jour d’outils pour aider les groupes dans leur travail de plaidoyer
participer à la réflexion sur la stratégie globale de la campagne
articleBodyHtml:
Le mouvement Alternatiba :

Alternatiba est un mouvement populaire pour le climat et la justice sociale qui se constitue d’un réseau de groupes locaux en France et d’autres pays francophones. L’enjeu de la séquence 2022-23 : 2023 sera l’année de mi-mandat municipal ; un important travail de préparation de ce temps et de communication doit être pensé.

  • Participer au suivi et à l’accompagnement des groupes locaux Alternatiba et ANV-COP21 dans leurs activités (campagnes globales ou locales)
  • Aider au suivi et recensement général de ce que fait notre réseau : mobilisations climat, actions et formations locales, campagnes locales

  • Renforcer l’équipe de coordination de la campagne Alternatives Territoriales :
  • accueillir les nouveaux groupes de travail qui se créent (envoyer un mail type de bienvenue, les appeler pour créer un premier contact, leur donner les informations de base sur la campagne)

  • participer à la création et à la mise à jour d’outils pour aider les groupes dans leur travail de plaidoyer
  • participer à la réflexion sur la stratégie globale de la campagne

headline: Association General Manager - Paris
author: Paris, France

breadcrumbs.name: Positive impact companies and associations that recruit
Association 1000 Visages recruitment
Association General Manager - Paris - Long term - Others - Arts and culture - 05-31-2022

description: Association 1000 Visages is recruiting a "Association General Manager - Paris" - Démocratisation des métiers du cinéma auprès des jeunes qui en sont éloignés pour des raisons économiques, géographiques et/ou sociales.
articleBody:
Sous l’autorité du Conseil d’Administration et en particulier du/de la Président.e, le ou la Directeur.rice a pour mission de diriger l’association. Vous œuvrez activement au rayonnement, au développement et à la cohérence du projet. À ce titre, vous serez responsable du projet de l'association. Vous aurez comme mission de proposer, d'animer et de mettre en œuvre la politique de l'association, l'ensemble de ses actions et de ses activités.

En lien étroit avec le Conseil d’Administration, vous développerez les partenariats et assurerez un développement ambitieux des projets, des moyens et des ressources.

· Co-construction avec le CA des orientations stratégiques, accompagnement de la gouvernance et pilotage de la mise en œuvre du projet.

· Impulsion et mise en œuvre d’une stratégie économique et partenariale (développement du mécénat, des partenariats publics et privés)

· Elaborer et développer avec le Conseil d’Administration, l’équipe et le comité pédagogique le programme des actions, des résidences, des ateliers. Piloter avec l’équipe la mise en place, la menée et l’évaluation des actions.

· Encadrer, animer et coordonner une équipe de 6 salariés et d’une dizaine d’intervenants. Assurer la stabilisation organisationnelle de l’association (organisation des missions, définition des fiches de postes, etc.) et menez la conduite d’une politique salariale globale et cohérente.

· Rechercher des financements et assurer, avec le ou la Trésorier.ère et la Présidence, la conduite des orientations budgétaires.

· Gestion et développement de l’ensemble des partenariats de l’association (associatifs, institutionnels, financiers) en lien fort avec le Conseil d’Administration.

· Coordination et mise en œuvre du bilan d’activités et vous le présentez à l’Assemblée Générale.

headline: Internship communication manager - Paris
author: Paris, France

breadcrumbs.name: Positive impact companies and associations that recruit
Bureaux du Coeur recruitment
Internship communication manager - Paris - Alternance - Communication, Community Management / Social Media, Press relations, Marketing - Associations - 05-31-2022

description: Bureaux du Coeur is recruiting a "Internship communication manager - Paris" - Favoriser et développer l'accueil de personnes en grande précarité au sein de bureaux d'entreprises le soir et le week-end
articleBody:
L’ASSOCIATION

Créée en 2020 par des entrepreneurs, l’association Les Bureaux du Cœur met en relation des personnes en grande précarité, les « invité.e.s », et des entreprises, les « hôtes », prêtes à mettre à disposition temporairement leurs locaux la nuit et le week-end.

Le principe ? Offrir un espace dédié à un.e invité.e au sein d’une entreprise hôte avec un coin nuit, un coin cuisine, une armoire qui ferme à clé, des sanitaires et souvent, une douche.

L’objectif ? Participer au processus de réinsertion des personnes en grande précarité en leur apportant un lieu de vie sûr, stable et digne, favorable à la création d’intimité et de lien social. Autant d’éléments nécessaires pour se reconstruire et sortir de la précarité.

Depuis sa création, ce sont déjà 110 invité.e.s dans 22 villes en France qui ont pu bénéficier des Bureaux du Cœur.

LA MISSION

L’idée des Bureaux du Cœur est simple mais révolutionnaire ! Pour cette raison, le projet suscite un énorme engouement. A chaque parution médiatique ou publication sur les réseaux sociaux, ce sont des dizaines d’entreprises qui nous contactent pour devenir hôtes et accueillir un.e invité.e.

Afin de contribuer au rayonnement de l’association en France, nous recherchons un.e Responsable de la Communication en alternance.

Sous la responsabilité de la Responsable du Développement, les missions seront les suivantes :

CREA/COMM

COMM INTERNE

…et toutes les autres missions que l’alternant souhaiterait prendre en charge !

author: Civic service / VSI

🙏 Volunteer for solidarity and disability in Annecy - Annecy - Civic service / VSI - Autres, Others - Social link - 05-31-2022

description: Unis-Cité is recruiting a "🙏 Volunteer for solidarity and disability in Annecy - Annecy" - Permettre aux jeunes (16 à 25 ans) de toutes origines sociales/culturelles la possibilité de s'engager pendant 8 mois, à temps plein et en équipe, sur des missions d'intérêt général et de solidarité
articleBody:
Tu es sensible à l’isolement des personnes en situation de handicap ? Tu souhaites t’engager et te sentir utile cette année ? Tu veux animer des projets en équipe dans la diversité avec d'autres jeunes ? Alors, rejoins la promotion et engage toi pour la solidarité.

Créer du lien avec des personnes en situation de handicap par l'organisation de visites à domicile
Etre en immersion 1 jour par semaine dans une structure spécialiste du handicap
Réaliser des animations collectives (ballades, animations en structures etc...)

Tu seras mobilisé.e sur cette mission 4 jours par semaine, en équipe de 4 jeunes, du mardi au vendredi. Pas besoin de diplôme, d’expérience ou de super-pouvoirs : seules ta motivation et ton envie de travailler en équipe sur cette mission comptent !

Tu bénéficieras de la formation PSC1 pour acquérir les gestes de premiers secours et de plusieurs journées de formation sur des enjeux de société.

Tu seras accompagné par une Coordinatrice pour mener à bien ta mission et d'un accompagnement individuel et collectif à ton projet d'avenir.

headline: Advocacy Internship 6 months F/M - Montreuil
author: Montreuil, France

breadcrumbs.name: Positive impact companies and associations that recruit
Emmaüs France recruitment
Advocacy Internship 6 months F/M - Montreuil - Internship - Communication, Others, Others, Others, Others - Responsible consumption - 05-31-2022

description: Emmaüs France is recruiting a "Advocacy Internship 6 months F/M - Montreuil" - Fabrique d’innovations sociales et de solidarités pour aider des publics en situation de grande précarité, et un front engagé et militant en faveur d’une société plus humaine et plus juste
articleBody:
1. Environnement, présentation de la structure et contexte

Emmaüs, mouvement solidaire et laïc, est engagé depuis 1949 dans la lutte contre la pauvreté et l’exclusion. En France, le Mouvement Emmaüs comporte 287 structures (associations, scic, scop…) représentant 12 000 bénévoles, 7 000 compagnes et compagnons et plus de 8 000 salariés dont plus de la moitié sont en insertion. Unies autour d’une même cause, ces structures sont réparties en 3 types d’activités : les communautés, l’action sociale et le logement, l’économie solidaire et d’insertion.

Pour mettre en œuvre ses orientations stratégiques, le Conseil d’Administration d’Emmaüs France s’appuie sur une équipe nationale d’environ 75 salarié.e.s. Celle-ci fournit aux structures Emmaüs des services d’accompagnement leur permettant de mener à bien leurs missions, anime l’ensemble du Mouvement en France et conduit des actions nationales de plaidoyer. L’équipe est structurée autour d’expertises transverses au service de l’ensemble des 290 groupes Emmaüs et d’un accompagnement « métier » correspondant au 3 types d’activités.

2. Le Pôle communication et plaidoyer

Il gère la communication interne et externe du mouvement. Ses missions se structurent autour :

- Du plaidoyer dans le champ des politiques sociales, migratoires, de l’emploi et de l’insertion.

- De l’organisation de manifestations et d’évènements citoyens à fort capital d’image.

- De la mise en place de systèmes de communication pour améliorer la circulation d’information entre la fédération et les acteurs de terrain.

- De la conception et réalisation d’outils et de campagne de promotion du mouvement à l’usage de l’interne et à destination de l’externe.

- Du développement de la notoriété et de l’influence d’Emmaüs, en particulier sur les réseaux sociaux et auprès des relais d’opinions.

- De la valorisation en externe des modèles alternatifs portés par le mouvement, notamment en matière de consommation socialement et écologiquement responsable, d’économie sociale et solidaire et d’économie circulaire.

3. Descriptif du stage

Sous la supervision de la Chargée de mission Plaidoyer et en lien avec le Directeur Communication/Plaidoyer, vous :

· Aidez à la réalisation et à la mise à jour d’une cartographie des acteurs-clés,

· Recherchez et synthétiser des informations (articles, rapports, infographies, citations) afin de produire des notes de synthèse sur les sujets portés par Emmaüs

· Participez à l’organisation d’évènement et au travail en coalition avec d’autres organisations de la société civile.

· Participez à des rendez-vous de plaidoyer

· Appuyez la mission Plaidoyer, selon les priorités du moment (rédaction de documents/articles, prise de notes, relations avec les autres départements, relations avec les autres partenaires/membres du mouvement Emmaüs/ONG, demandes d’information, recherches, etc.)

· Assurez la veille et la collecte d’informations sur les politiques gouvernementales, législatives et les thématiques d’Emmaüs (lutte contre la pauvreté, l’économie sociale et solidaire, emploi, justice / prison…)

Lieu de travail : siège d’Emmaüs France, Montreuil mais quelques déplacements à prévoir en dehors de Paris.

Le stage débute à partir de septembre 2022

Durée : stage conventionné de 6 mois
articleBodyHtml:

Emmaüs, mouvement solidaire et laïc, est engagé depuis 1949 dans la lutte contre la pauvreté et l’exclusion. headline: Support Officer for the Tarn et Garonne Local Support Scheme - Toulouse
author: Long term

breadcrumbs.name: Positive impact companies and associations that recruit
FRANCE ACTIVE MPA - OCCITANIE recruitment
Support Officer for the Tarn et Garonne Local Support Scheme - Toulouse - Long term - Autres, Strategy, Others, Mission manager, Coordination - Others - 05-30-2022

description: FRANCE ACTIVE MPA - OCCITANIE is recruiting a " Support Officer for the Tarn et Garonne Local Support Scheme - Toulouse" - France Active MPA-Occitanie, permet aux entrepreneurs de s’investir dans leur projet porteur d’impacts positifs.
articleBody:
Contexte

France Active MPA-Occitanie, affiliée au réseau France Active permet aux entrepreneurs de s’investir dans leur projet porteur d’impacts positifs. Créer et développer son activité, s’engager sur son territoire, donner du sens à son projet entrepreneurial et transformer la société : c’est le pari des entrepreneurs engagés.

Au plus près de leurs besoins, les 30 salariés de France Active MPA-Occitanie les conseillent et les accompagnent, leur donnent accès aux capitaux et leur permettent d’accéder à un réseau unique d’acteurs économiques et sociaux de proximité.

Notre raison d’être : donner aux entrepreneurs les moyens d’agir.

France Active MPA-Occitanie a été mandatée par l'État et la Banque des Territoires pour être la structure support du Dispositif Local d'Accompagnement sur les territoires de la Haute-Garonne, des Hautes-Pyrénées et du Tarn-et-Garonne. Le Dispositif Local d’Accompagnement accompagne les structures de l’économie sociale et solidaire dans la création et la consolidation d’emploi, l’adaptation des activités aux évolutions de l’environnement, la structuration du modèle économique ou encore l’ancrage sur le territoire d’action.

France Active MPA-Occitanie recrute un(e) chargé(e) d’accompagnement au sein du DLA 82.

Missions

· Accueillir, informer, orienter les structures

· Réaliser les diagnostics partagés de la situation organisationnelle, économique / financière et sociale et construire des parcours d’accompagnement individualisés

· Mener des diagnostics partagés pour plusieurs structures : conduire une analyse partagée des enjeux/besoins, faire un focus sur la situation individuelle des structures puis synthétiser et formaliser un parcours d’accompagnement collectif

· Mettre en œuvre les plans d’accompagnement : définition des appuis confiés à des prestataires extérieurs, individuels et collectifs, rédaction de cahiers des charges, appel à concurrence et sélection de prestataires, lancement et suivi des missions d’accompagnement

· Consolider l’accompagnement : suivi post-accompagnement, mesures d’impact de l’accompagnement et évaluation du prestataire

2- Animation territoriale et partenariale

· Organiser et animer les comités d’appui locaux

· Animer des réunions partenariales thématiques, sectorielles, groupe d’appui ou groupe ressource, mobilisés spécifiquement pour les besoins d’une association ou d’un groupe de structures

· Alimenter l’analyse des besoins territoriaux (diagnostics sectoriels et territoriaux)

· Organiser et développer les partenariats, articuler l’activité au niveau départemental

· Faire connaître et valoriser l’activité et les dispositifs, organiser des réunions d’information

· Participer aux réseaux d’accompagnement départemental, régional et national

3. Gestion, pilotage de l’activité DLA 82

· Définir les orientations stratégiques annuelles : construire des propositions de scenarios prévisionnels budgétaires d’activité et d’orientations stratégiques

· Assurer le suivi régulier de l’activité et des orientations : saisir les objectifs, enveloppes financières et mettre à jour la nomenclature dans les reportings, sécuriser en binôme les données d’activité, garantir un suivi régulier de l’avancement des objectifs quantitatifs, de la consommation de l’enveloppe financière et des tendances sectorielles, thématiques

· Garantir le suivi des conventions : rédiger demandes de financement et bilans annuels ou pluriannuels (cerfa, réponse appel à projet), contribuer à tout document de valorisation de l’activité DLA (rapport d’activité…)

· Garantir le suivi des relations et des instances de pilotages : organiser et animer en collaboration avec les pilotes le dialogue de gestion et le comité de pilotage, assurer le suivi de la relation avec les pilotes

4. Maîtrise du programme d’activité et participation à la mise en œuvre de la stratégie FAMPAO

· Participer à l’élaboration du programme d’activités

description: Amnesty International France is recruiting a "Technical referent SalesForce - Paris" - Mouvement international, impartial et indépendant de défense et promotion des droits humains dans le monde.
articleBody:
Sous la responsabilité de la responsable du service CRM et Data, au sein d’une équipe composée d’un data analyst et d’une administratrice SalesForce, vous interviendrez aussi bien sur la maintenance que sur l’amélioration continue ou le développement de nouveaux projets. Vous collaborerez au quotidien avec les équipes de l'intégrateur en charge de la TMA et d’une partie des évolutions SalesForce, et vous serez garant.e de la faisabilité dans SalesForce des besoins exprimés par les utilisateurs avec qui vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration.

PRINCIPALES ACTIVITES :

- Analyses d'impacts et réalisation des chiffrages associés

- Préconisation et pilotage de solutions techniques fiables dans le respect des bonnes pratiques et standards de qualité SalesForce

- Rédaction et/ou analyse des spécifications techniques

- Conception et développement et/ou paramétrage de la solution

- Rédaction et réalisation des tests techniques

- Participation aux tests fonctionnels et accompagnement des utilisateurs

- Contribution à la formation et au support utilisateurs

headline: Social Innovation Consulting Project Manager - Paris
author: Paris, France

breadcrumbs.name: Positive impact companies and associations that recruit
Alter'Actions recruitment
Social Innovation Consulting Project Manager - Paris - Civic service / VSI - Autres, Others, Strategy, Others, Mission manager - Consulting - 05-30-2022

description: Alter'Actions is recruiting a "Social Innovation Consulting Project Manager - Paris" - Accompagner les structures de l'ESS dans leur développement en leur permettant de bénéficier de missions de conseil solidaires réalisées par des étudiants et consultants bénévoles engagés
articleBody:
La Mission sociale :

Alter’Actions assemble les énergies et les compétences au service de l’Economie Sociale et Solidaire!

Créé en 2010, Alter’Actions est un programme engageant les différentes forces de la société dans une dynamique de création de valeurs pour l’Économie Sociale et Solidaire.

Ce programme pédagogique est destiné aux élèves (de la L3 au M2) de Grandes Écoles (commerce et ingénieurs) et d’Universités. Il est proposé aux étudiants sur 1 an comme une double formation, en parallèle de leurs études.

Alter’Actions propose à des étudiants (sélectionnés sur leur motivation et leur appétence pour les sujets de l’ESS) de réaliser pour des acteurs de l’ESS (associations, fondations, coopératives,…) des missions de conseil bénévoles en équipe (généralement de 4 étudiants provenant de différents cursus) et encadrées par des professionnels du conseil, issus de nos entreprises partenaires).

Il s’agit à la fois de sensibiliser et d’augmenter le niveau de conscience des étudiants et des managers d’entreprises partenaires aux problématiques de l’ESS, et de faire bénéficier les acteurs de ce domaine de missions à forte valeur ajoutée pour leur développement, au cœur de leurs préoccupations stratégiques. Les missions Alter’Actions sont de différentes natures (benchmark, étude de faisabilité, stratégies de communication, revue stratégique 360°, audit interne, évaluation d’impact,…)

A ce jour, près de 1053 étudiants ont réalisé au total 348 missions encadrées par 306 managers du milieu du conseil pour plus de 259 acteurs de l’ESS.

Alter’Actions, c’est avant tout un savoir-faire unique de création de valeur ayant un fort impact sociétal grâce au rassemblement des acteurs et à l’activation de transferts de compétences. Les étudiants et managers sont formés et accompagnés pour apporter une réponse personnalisée aux besoins des acteurs de l’ESS.

à la définition des missions de conseil de la « vague d’automne » 2022 ;
au bon lancement et déroulement des missions de conseil en lien avec les étudiants, les managers et les associations (début des missions en février - vingtaine de missions) ;
à l’analyse des résultats et la diffusion des synthèses des enquêtes de satisfaction auprès des étudiants, des managers, et des associations bénéficiaires ;
à la mise en place d’une mesure d’impact de nos missions de conseil passées auprès de nos anciens bénéficiaires ;
à la prise de contact avec de nouvelles organisations de l’ESS, la présentation du programme Alter’Actions et l’identification de futurs bénéficiaires potentiels et des sujets de missions de conseil futures
à l’animation des outils de communication (site internet, réseaux sociaux, réalisation d’interviews de nos bénéficiaires,…).

headline: Internship or work-study offer: Communication officer - Paris
author: Alternance

breadcrumbs.name: Positive impact companies and associations that recruit
GREENLOBBY recruitment

Internship or work-study offer: Communication officer - Paris - Alternance, Internship - Community Management / Social Media, Communication, Strategic Marketing, Traffic Management - Ecology - 05-30-2022

description: GREENLOBBY is recruiting a "Internship or work-study offer: Communication officer - Paris" - Changer la loi, le chemin le plus rapide pour mieux vivre, créer de l'emploi, dynamiser les territoires, mieux répartir les richesses et respecter les limites planétaires.
articleBody:
Offre de stage : Chargé.e de communication

Mission sociale de greenlobby :

Changer la loi, le chemin le plus rapide pour mieux vivre, créer de l'emploi, dynamiser les territoires, mieux répartir les richesses et respecter les limites planétaires.

Description de l'offre :

L’organisation

Greenlobby est un cabinet d’influence qui aide les acteurs à fort impact (écologique et social) à devenir prescripteur des politiques publiques. Nous accompagnons des entreprises engagées et des associations pour mieux porter leur voix auprès des décideurs politiques et faire voter des lois à la hauteur des enjeux de notre siècle.

Nous utilisons les mêmes techniques que les lobbies historiques : amendements prêts à l’emploi, maîtrise du jeu politique, power mapping. En parallèle, nous avons développé notre propre recette magique : création d’alliances innovantes, mobilisation des ONG et des citoyens, expérimentations sur le terrain….

2022 est une année clef sur le plan politique : nouveau Parlement, nouveau gouvernement. C’est le moment où jamais de rééquilibrer le rapport de force et de donner du pouvoir aux acteurs à impact écologique et social.

Vous êtes étudiant.e ou en reconversion professionnelle, vous cherchez à vous professionnaliser dans la communication, le plaidoyer ou l’écologie/la justice sociale ?

Vous êtes au bon endroit.

La mission

1/ Elaborer et implémenter une stratégie de communication pour Greenlobby

Élaboration des stratégies de diffusion pour gagner en notoriété et visibilité
Planification de l’utilisation des réseaux sociaux et du site internet pour communiquer sur l’actualité et sur Greenlobby
Production de supports variés de communication digitale

2/ Assurer la communication des campagnes de Greenlobby et de ses partenaires

Rédaction et création de contenu digital pour les campagnes (newsletter, tribunes, articles, infographies, vidéos...).
Communication avec les élus et les institutions
Production d’argumentaires contextualisés en réaction à l’actualité politique, environnementale et sociale

Le profil

Bac+3 minimum. Formation en école de communication, en IEP ou grande école de commerce
Maîtrise des outils de production de contenus digitaux et des réseaux sociaux
Animé.e par les questions écologiques, sociales et démocratiques et disposant d’une culture politique
Aisance relationnelle et qualités rédactionnelles
Une première expérience dans le domaine de la communication et/ou du lobbying/plaidoyer est un atout
Motivé.e, engagé.e, créatif.ve, avec une forte envie de participer à une aventure entrepreneuriale pour le monde de demain !

Les conditions

Alternance de 1 an ou stage non rémunéré (moins de 2 mois en temps plein ou moins de 6 en temps partiel)

Début : septembre. Merci de bien vouloir préciser vos disponibilités dans la durée lors de votre candidature.

Localisation : flexible – télétravail et espace de travail sur Paris

Candidater

Description de l'offre :

L’organisation

Greenlobby est un cabinet d’influence qui aide les acteurs à fort impact (écologique et social) à devenir prescripteur des politiques publiques. Nous accompagnons des entreprises engagées et des associations pour mieux porter leur voix auprès des décideurs politiques et faire voter des lois à la hauteur des enjeux de notre siècle.

Nous utilisons les mêmes techniques que les lobbies historiques : amendements prêts à l’emploi, maîtrise du jeu politique, power mapping. En parallèle, nous avons développé notre propre recette magique : création d’alliances innovantes, mobilisation des ONG et des citoyens, expérimentations sur le terrain….

2022 est une année clef sur le plan politique : nouveau Parlement, nouveau gouvernement. C’est le moment où jamais de rééquilibrer le rapport de force et de donner du pouvoir aux acteurs à impact écologique et social.

Vous êtes étudiant.e ou en reconversion professionnelle, vous cherchez à vous professionnaliser dans la communication, le plaidoyer ou l’écologie/la justice sociale ?

Vous êtes au bon endroit.

La mission

1/ Elaborer et implémenter une stratégie de communication pour Greenlobby

  • Élaboration des stratégies de diffusion pour gagner en notoriété et visibilité
  • Planification de l’utilisation des réseaux sociaux et du site internet pour communiquer sur l’actualité et sur Greenlobby
  • Production de supports variés de communication digitale

2/ Assurer la communication des campagnes de Greenlobby et de ses partenaires

  • Rédaction et création de contenu digital pour les campagnes (newsletter, tribunes, articles, infographies, vidéos...).
  • Communication avec les élus et les institutions
  • Production d’argumentaires contextualisés en réaction à l’actualité politique, environnementale et sociale

Le profil

  • Bac+3 minimum. Formation en école de communication, en IEP ou grande école de commerce
  • Maîtrise des outils de production de contenus digitaux et des réseaux sociaux
  • Animé.e par les questions écologiques, sociales et démocratiques et disposant d’une culture politique
  • Aisance relationnelle et qualités rédactionnelles
  • Une première expérience dans le domaine de la communication et/ou du lobbying/plaidoyer est un atout
  • Motivé.e, engagé.e, créatif.ve, avec une forte envie de participer à une aventure entrepreneuriale pour le monde de demain !

Les conditions

Alternance de 1 an ou stage non rémunéré (moins de 2 mois en temps plein ou moins de 6 en temps partiel)

Début : septembre. Merci de bien vouloir préciser vos disponibilités dans la durée lors de votre candidature.

Localisation : flexible – télétravail et espace de travail sur Paris

Candidater

headline: "Thinking the ecological and social transition in a systemic way" with Thomas Merzlic (T-Campus)
author: Fabien Secherre
description: From the tire to the eco-place, discover the journey of Thomas Merzlic, who presents the T-Campus immersion program.
articleBody:
Can you tell us about your background, and what brought you to where you are today?

My name is Thomas Merzlic, I am 25 years old. I have a scientific background and graduated from the SIGMA Clermont engineering school in mechanical engineering. I worked for Michelin for a year as a design engineer, from 2019 to 2020.

The front door of my commitment was food. Through this prism, I gradually became aware of the interconnection of socio-environmental issues and the importance of addressing them systemically. To establish my legitimacy and bring consistency to the knowledge acquired on the right and on the left, I decided to participate, in 2020, in the T-Campus. I met Benoît Montels, the founder of the Château d'Arvieu project, who told me about the project and the needs on site. I resigned from my CDI to embark on my professional transition by signing a 9-month civic service mission in the association Bienvenue en Transition, at the initiative of the Château d'Arvieu project. I am still in this association, this time on a fixed-term contract, to organize and lead the two editions of the T-Campus training, in spring and autumn 2022.

What did you start from, why did you create this training?

The social, ecological and climatic crises are increasingly felt and everything suggests that they will not be resolved if we do not change our lifestyles, our relationship to others, to nature and to ourselves. At the same time, more and more people are concerned about these issues and are looking for meaning in their professional and personal lives.

Based on these observations, we wish, through the T-Campus training, to provide keys to think about the ecological and social transition in a systemic way and allow participants to (re)find meaning in their actions and projects.

Concretely, what is the typical day/week/curriculum of a student within the training?

For 6 weeks, participants will be immersed in an eco-place where the times of daily life will be shared with the whole group whenever they wish.

The days will begin with a "morning word" which will be an opportunity to share a first collective moment where participants will be invited to share their feelings, a work and to play together.

This will be followed by training times in the morning and afternoon by speakers of various expertise using an integral pedagogy involving the head, the body and the heart.

The group also participates in the life of an eco-place: preparing dinner, maintaining common areas, gardening or DIY.

Participate in gardening with T-Campus

What are the 3 strengths of your program?

The training is made up of three highlights. The first is the teaching of observations to develop a global vision of the challenges of our time and find its place in them, with very diverse interventions: from climate issues to ethical dilemmas, from the economy to governance systems, from agriculture to the management of the commons.

Then, the group will have the opportunity to take part in a trip to eco-places to discover places, alternative projects and meet the people who bring these initiatives to life.

And finally, the third highlight is the week of specialization, at your choice, on the dynamics of territories in Arvieu (12) or on sociology-politics at the Campus de la Transition (77). This will be an opportunity to apply certain knowledge and to experiment with action levers at the local or macroscopic level.

Throughout the training, time will be devoted to personal and/or professional projects, during group or individual time.

What do we do when we leave?

As mentioned above, the T-Campus helps participants, of various profiles, to identify their means of action.

Some do not have a well-defined project, others have one and wish to refine it during the 6 weeks of training.

Some are employed or in study and return to their company/school to participate in its development by integrating socio-environmental issues.

Others identify subjects or sectors of activity to deepen and choose to follow additional training.

There is therefore not a typical course upon leaving training but a multitude reflecting the diversity of the profiles that make it up.

In any case, you join a network of alumni that grows year after year!

How did you find out about jobs_that_makesense and why did you join the catalog?

A friend and former T-Campus training participant told us about Jobs. We got in touch with the team and very much appreciated the attention they gave us. They pay particular attention to our needs and are very good advice to support us in our development.

In addition, we also wanted to test the interest of our training with the audience of the platform and it is a success!

The final word?

Do you feel like an Indian in the city faced with the awareness of transition issues? Join the T-Campus training to deepen your knowledge, identify your means of action in the transition and connect with people who are asking the same questions as you.

headline: [Interview] Côme, co-founder of La Joist - training in energy renovation
author: Fabien Secherre
description: With 600,000 additional people to be trained by 2050, the building energy renovation sector is on the rise! Discover the challenges and possible training for this sector of the future!
articleBody:
Can you tell us about yourself? What was your background? Why energy retrofit?

At first, I had an engineering background, rather generalist, but I became interested in energy & climate issues very early on. I started working at Carbone 4, a consulting firm specializing in these issues, where I began to dig into the building sector, then inevitably that of energy renovation. It is important to point out that buildings represent nearly half of our energy consumption, or more than a quarter of our national emissions: the site is daunting!

I then joined the office of the Minister of Housing to work on public policies related to energy renovation and new construction. It was in this context that I met Ariane, whom I finally joined to create La Solive, the school of energy renovation, and allow all those who wish to convert to these jobs of the future!

We hear more and more about energy renovation, why is it exploding at the moment?

That's pretty impressive by the way! For 2-3 years, energy renovation has been on the rise: everyone has their opinion on the issue, the media talk about it daily, politicians are not left out and all these beautiful people are sounding. I think there are several factors that can explain why energy renovation is exploding.

First a political will, with more and more money on the table, regulations & incentives that are increasingly strong (ban on rentals for thermal colanders, obligation to audit when put on sale colanders, success of MaPrimeRénov', etc.) with the resulting unprecedented visibility. Indeed, the subject affects everyone.

I also think that confinement made many people realize that their accommodation was not very comfortable (too hot, too cold or too expensive) and that it really bothered them on a daily basis. If we add to that the increase in energy prices...

What are the big challenges for the energy retrofit sector in the coming years?

The main challenge for the sector is training.

The training of craftsmen and companies as a first step, in order to improve the quality of energy renovations. Regulations are increasingly pushing global and ambitious renovations, which make it possible to achieve greater energy savings. This requires learning to work with other artisans, keeping up to date with new techniques, and therefore training!

And then there is the subject of recruitment, and the number of people in the sector… To reach our objectives in terms of the number of energy renovations, it is estimated that we must train 600,000 additional people by 2050! Whether through initial training or professional retraining, it will be necessary to train battalions of highly motivated people given the scale of the work and the shortage of qualified profiles that we are already experiencing today...

It's true that today finding a heating engineer can take 18 months...

And yes, and it will not improve if we do not accelerate the pace with new entrants because many retirements are expected in the coming years. Unfortunately, this concerns the whole profession, and it is not only heating engineers who are missing...

What professions already exist and which ones will emerge?

Those that do exist and are in very high tension are the trades of skilled craftsmen: heating engineers, especially specialized in heat pumps and wood stoves, and insulation experts, mainly in thermal insulation by outside.

Those that emerge are versatile profiles capable of supporting individuals in their work project, in their technical, administrative or financial procedures and in monitoring the site.

What are the exit salaries?

With increasingly rare profiles and increasing demand, salaries are being pushed up. If we put aside the self-employed, a specialized and salaried heating engineer can easily start at €2,500 gross, and a project manager at €3,000. Obviously, it will depend on the profile and the company… but it can be much more!

headline: Entrepreneurship in the territories: is it the right time?
author: Olivier Girinon
description: The health crisis has given rise to many desires to reconnect with nature. To go beyond the fantasies of life in the countryside, Yannick Rasoava presents us with the issues of entrepreneurship in semi-rural areas and the challenges of these territories.
articleBody:
At the end of lockdown, many Ile-de-France residents chose to leave Paris for a less stressful environment closer to nature. These people are looking for a simpler life in line with their values.

We are still far from the urban exodus, however 60% of French people say that if they had to create a business, they would do it outside the city. Added to this is the desire to realize an impact project aligned with their engines and which has a local anchorage.

For many, the equation becomes complex because:

Nevertheless, they are burning to take action!

Territories, new Eldorado of the ecological transition?

Paris, like many cities, is on the path to ecological transition. However, their actions remain limited by a set of severe constraints and a relatively limited living potential on their perimeter.

On the other hand, peripheral rural areas offer potential for action to materialize commitments in favor of ecological transition. However, to positively transform this potential, it is necessary to reinvest these neglected territories by integrating them into a logic of cooperative development and respectful of their identity.

There are therefore many opportunities for entrepreneurship in the territories, but today few actors to seize them.

To accelerate the ecological transition in the territories, we have structured 6 challenges that you will see in detail a little further down.

Entrepreneurship, who said it would be easy?

Are you full of energy, are you ready to pack your bags to seize these opportunities? Be careful, even with the best intentions in the world, you will not miss some challenges.

1. Maintain a constant level of energy

Given space, energy and time, nature is able to create life everywhere. Entrepreneurship is no exception to this universal rule. It needs time and energy to live and grow. For this he needs:

clear objectives,
a caring community,
methods
good state of mind.

2. Take care of those around you

Even if your close personal entourage supports you in your desire for adventure, one of the first pitfalls of the entrepreneur is loneliness. And this is all the more true in sparsely populated territories because the kilometers sometimes separate us from the ecosystems of impact entrepreneurs.

Surrounding yourself with a caring community that shares your desire to act is key to building a team, finding your first associates or simply continuing to stay in action. It may take time, but once the connections are made, they are often more concrete and authentic than anywhere else.

It is therefore important to join ecosystems in phase with your values, which will continue to inspire you and support your actions. Do not hesitate to leverage digital to keep and consolidate your links.

3. Be vigilant and maintain a territorial balance

It is likely that your desire to act upsets some habits. Even more if you try to innovate. It takes time to be accepted into a new community.

The key is to co-construct with the actors of the territory. By engaging them very early in your adventure, you will ensure that your desire to undertake will address a HARD problem (painful, urgent and recognized). Also make sure to communicate with generosity, on the problems you are going to solve, to engage a first community that will open the doors of your territory to you.

Align its planets and provoke destiny

It is often said that entrepreneurship requires an alignment of the planets. I would add that entrepreneurship also means knowing how to identify your own planets.

When undertaking for the first time, it is not forbidden to be accompanied to provoke destiny. Especially since there are formulas that have proven themselves to succeed in your entrepreneurial adventure.

Simple formulas...but far from magical.

For example, with Ré-enchanter nos campagnes we have developed the following 3 pillars to unrisk your entrepreneurial adventure in the territories.

1. Join a collective that will take up a challenge in line with your driving forces

At this stage we will not yet talk about a project. During this phase, we will identify the challenge that corresponds to your deep desires. We will then explore and identify a real need for territory that will be the basis of a viable project that will allow you to live from it.

2. Adopt the tools and mindset of the innovative entrepreneur

Even if each entrepreneurial adventure is unique (because remember, you are unique!). We have an almost crystal ball that will give you visibility on the emotional stages that you will experience on your way to becoming an entrepreneur. We will never repeat it enough, entrepreneurship is not easy. But with the method, the right state of mind and the right entourage, there are many barriers that we can overcome together.

3. Experiment with the actors of the territory to bring out a concrete project

This experimentation phase will allow you to confront your assumptions on the ground and validate a value proposition. You will build with the stakeholders, a concept that will meet a real need.

Structured challenges to go faster and further

At Le Bastion, we have structured 6 challenges of the ecological transition which constitute territorial needs. Our partners stand ready to co-construct with the participants of the Re-enchant our campaigns scheme.

Challenge #1 - Act on a healthy food offer in the territories

You will become an actor in the food resilience of the territories; whether from the perspective of production, processing or preservation of land and biodiversity.

You will rework uses to develop resilient habitats that promote social ties, preserve resources, create accessibility and autonomy.

This challenge will allow you to become an actor in the resilience of territories by helping to limit its dependence on incoming resource flows. You will also be an actor in territorial innovation, through the development and promotion of new sectors and non-relocatable jobs.

Act for a more sustainable, economical and accessible mobility of goods and people. The challenge is to make it a lever for the economic development of a territory and a factor of social integration for citizens.

Become an actor in the preservation of heritage, biodiversity and social ties in the territories.

headline: How to finance your vocational training
author: Fabien Secherre
description: Sophie Carretero, professional development consultant at APEC, presents the various aids for professional retraining. CPF, PTP, ... These terms will no longer hold any secrets for you!
articleBody:
You have decided to embark on a professional retraining, but you do not know how to finance your training? This question comes up regularly, the question of financing is even one of the main obstacles to the professional transition to jobs with a positive impact.

Sophie Carretero, professional development consultant at APEC (Association Pour l’Emploi des Cadres), presents the various existing systems, beyond the CPF.

The Personal Training Account

The best known of the mechanisms for financing his professional training. The Personal Training Account allows you to acquire training rights in the form of euros throughout your professional life, available to all workers. These training rights can be used until retirement.

Who is the CPF for ?

The Personal Training Account is aimed at all assets: public sector employees, private sector, entrepreneurs

How much money can I have available to fund my training with the CPF?

You benefit from 500€ of "credit" per year for full-time work, cumulative up to 5000€ on the Personal Training Account.

How to benefit from the CPF?

Check that the training you wish to carry out is eligible for the CPF (diploma or certification training registered in the RNCP or in the specific directory). On jobs_that_makesense, we indicate the training courses that are eligible
The subject of vocational training does not need to be directly related to his current job
Training must take place outside working hours (unless agreed with the employer). The process can be confidential, your employer is not necessarily informed
If you are unemployed, you can completely follow your training. Ask your Pôle Emploi adviser to keep them informed of your approach.

For public employees, these training rights are counted in hours and not in euros.
Employees who have not reached level 3 training (CAP BEP) have a CPF credit of €800 with a ceiling of €8,000
During a period of unemployment, the active person does not generate new rights but can use his CPF credit.

What if I don't have enough money on my CPF to fund my training?

If you lack credits to finance your training, you have the possibility of requesting contributions from your CPF

You are an employee and your employer agrees with your training: the latter can pay a sum of money into the personal training account of his/her employee
You have had an accident at work or an occupational disease: you can also request a top-up (👉 find out more)
articleBodyHtml:
You have decided to embark on a professional retraining, but you do not know how to finance your training? This question comes up regularly, the question of financing is even one of the main obstacles to the professional transition to jobs with a positive impact.

Sophie Carretero, professional development consultant at APEC (Association Pour l’Emploi des Cadres), presents the various existing systems, beyond the CPF.

The Personal Training Account

The best known of the mechanisms for financing his professional training. The Personal Training Account allows you to acquire training rights in the form of euros throughout your professional life, available to all workers. These training rights can be used until retirement.

Who is the CPF for ?

The Personal Training Account is aimed at all assets: public sector employees, private sector, entrepreneurs

How much money can I have available to fund my training with the CPF?

You benefit from 500€ of "credit" per year for full-time work, cumulative up to 5000€ on the Personal Training Account.

How to benefit from the CPF?

  • Check that the training you wish to carry out is eligible for the CPF (diploma or certification training registered in the RNCP or in the specific directory). On jobs_that_makesense, we indicate the training courses that are eligible
  • The subject of vocational training does not need to be directly related to his current job
  • Training must take place outside working hours (unless agreed with the employer). The process can be confidential, your employer is not necessarily informed
  • If you are unemployed, you can completely follow your training. Ask your Pôle Emploi adviser to keep them informed of your approach.
  • For public employees, these training rights are counted in hours and not in euros.
  • Employees who have not reached level 3 training (CAP BEP) have a CPF credit of €800 with a ceiling of €8,000
  • During a period of unemployment, the active person does not generate new rights but can use his CPF credit.

What if I don't have enough money on my CPF to fund my training?

If you lack credits to finance your training, you have the possibility of requesting contributions from your CPF

  • You are an employee and your employer agrees with your training: the latter can pay a sum of money into the personal training account of his/her employee
  • You have had an accident at work or an occupational disease: you can also request a top-up (👉 find out more)

headline: Make a professional retraining at 50
author: Manon Averty
description: There is no age to change lanes. Just because you're 50 doesn't mean you have to give it up. Discover the steps to succeed in your conversion and the prejudices to dismantle.
articleBody:
Are you no longer satisfied with your current professional situation? Do you aspire to new responsibilities, a new air, a new job...? Isn't the idea of ​​retraining at age 50 illusory and pointless? Of course not ! As a fifty-year-old, you still have ten years of work ahead of you (at least). So, to no longer suffer from your career and flourish in your professional life, the idea of ​​changing paths and retraining seems to be more than ever the way to go. jobs_that_makesense guides you through a professional retraining at 50 step by step.

The 6 reasons that lead you to consider a professional retraining at 50

A meaningless job

Between the beginning of your career and today, there have been titanic changes, whether in the world of work or in your private life.

What made you want to surpass yourself in your professional activity at the time is probably no longer a sufficient source of motivation today.

Now in your fifties, you feel the need to make yourself useful, to carry out missions with genuine interest. No more spending days behind a desk to achieve uninteresting goals. Nor to mechanically fill in Excel tables and administrative files of all kinds. Before this weariness turns into discomfort or burnout, you think it's time to completely change your career.

So you are looking for a job that makesense and fits with your values, even if it means making a 180° professional change. This is good, because like you, many people want to go into professions focused on the social, the environment and solidarity.

The desire to break away from the daily grind

In women, as in men, there are periods of our lives when we feel the need to evolve, to break the routine, to change our lives.

Turning 50 can be a perfect time to see your professional life in a new light. The opportunity to embark on a possible conversion to a new profession or a new sector of activity.

The desire for change to use your skills and experience differently

You have been working in the business world for 20 to 30 years now. Whatever your job and your field, during all these years you have had to develop a lot of knowledge, know-how and interpersonal skills. It is even possible that you have a high level of competence in several sectors.

Thanks to a professional reorientation, you hope to be able to enhance your experience within a company or an organization that will know how to recognize you at your fair value. And you will pay him back.

Working to change the world and society doesn't sound like an uninteresting midlife crisis!

Personal and professional maturity

Over the years, you have acquired a maturity that you did not have at the start of your career. You are therefore in a better position to know which professional environment suits you. If it's time to attempt a professional size change.

In addition, if for a long time the profiles of fifty-year-olds were shunned by recruiters, more and more companies are realizing the interest of having mature and experienced people within their team.

Rhythm

After the fifties, we no longer always have the energy or the health to maintain a frantic pace. If we are not yet classified in the senior category, we can still hope to enjoy a fulfilling job that allows us to find a more pleasant professional/personal life balance.

Retraining professionally at fifty or more can thus be an opportunity to review your priorities. This in order to reorient oneself towards a position with more suitable hours or professional mobility.

Financial stability

As we have discussed previously, around the age of fifty our life is rather well established. One can therefore have the chance to enjoy financial stability after having finished repaying large loans. Or simply no longer have dependent children and for whom to finance expensive studies.

Without these multiple financial constraints, it is often easier to allow yourself a few freedoms to better develop professionally. You are therefore thinking of professional retraining to evolve in the profession or sector that you are passionate about.

I'm taking the leap: Successful professional retraining in 7 steps

Do some introspection and list your priorities

Two important facts to keep in mind if you are considering quitting your job to embark on a career change:

Major professional changes cannot be improvised.
No big decision should be made on a whim.

If you do not follow these 2 basic principles, the risk of failing can be significant.

So, to put the odds on your side and see your project succeed, it is important to reflect and ask yourself the right questions:

Why do you want to change careers?
Which sector do you want to go to?
Is this a growing field?
Would you be fit to start now or would you need some training?

Once the main lines have been laid out, you can list what you think will be a priority in your future professional life (responsibilities, usefulness, skill development, freedom, etc.), but also the prohibitive factors. On another page, write down the activities and missions that you like to do and for which you have great know-how.

You can start with .

Carry out a skills assessment

In addition to the work of introspection, it is often recommended that people considering a professional retraining at the age of 50 take a skills assessment. This will help you define your new professional project more precisely.

jobs_that_makesense also offers a selection of skills assessments to help you to take stock.

Receive training

Training is often necessary in cases of professional retraining towards jobs with a positive impact. Depending on the path you want to follow, you will certainly need to expand certain knowledge and acquire new ones.

This can be a VAE (Validation of Acquired Experience), or training and qualifications available on your Personal Training Account.

We also suggest that people in your situation take a tour of the training available to start this new stage of your professional life with as many advantages as possible.

It can be:

Training allowing to develop soft skills who are highly sought after in the impact professions. Including non-violent communication, mobilization, facilitation...
Generalist training to acquire a solid foundation in order to carry out an activity related to the ecological and social transition and above all to better understand the challenges of this field
Specific training focused on key transition professions such as becoming a farmer, opening a third place, devoting oneself to the energy renovation of buildings, etc.

Identify your strengths and know how to highlight them

After this possible training, you will have new tricks up your sleeve. It is then up to you to identify all of your strengths in view of your applications.

You necessarily have good arguments to defend the quality of your profile. And this, even if your age makes you doubt your professional qualities in the face of younger candidates.

So start by redoing your CV. Then, practice in anticipation of the interviews, because this is when you will have to give everything to convince the recruiter. He will surely ask you to present the reasons for your professional retraining.

Analyze job opportunities

Thanks to a lot of personal work, you have a clearer and more precise vision of your professional retraining. The idea now is to take a closer look at the job market you are interested in to see if your project is feasible.

Often we do not know enough about the realities of the professional world. Taking a close interest in it allows you to clearly broaden your horizons. In the field of impact jobs, for example, we imagine that we are dealing with a very limited sector while it harbors an infinity of possibilities.

Do not hesitate to satisfy your curiosity and consult the latest job offers published on jobs_that_makesense. You can even create alerts so you don't miss any opportunities!

Opt for a real-life test

So as not to launch yourself into a whole new field blindly, today it is possible to carry out tests in companies to discover the reality on the ground. Like a discovery internship, this short period of immersion allows you to confirm or invalidate your choice of retraining by getting an idea of ​​the job as close as possible to reality.

Use your network

Have you thought about your professional or personal network to help you in your professional retraining project? There is nothing better than reconnecting with former colleagues or classmates to gain access to professional opportunities even before the job offers are posted.

The 4 brakes facing a professional retraining in the fifties

Financial risk

If you hold a position with comfortable remuneration, it is quite conceivable to take the financial factor into account before embarking on a professional retraining.

It is not always possible to take the plunge when you risk jeopardizing your personal life. Whether at the moment t to pay his bills, or in the more or less near future, concerning the calculation of the amount of his retirement pension.

However, it should be borne in mind that jobs in the social and solidarity economy (SSE) do not necessarily rhyme with precariousness. The same applies to a reorientation with a permanent position in a committed SME. According to a recent APEC study, the wage gap between the traditional economy and the SSE for equivalent skills does not exceed 10%.

The fear of the Unknown

For many, the unknown and the new represent a danger that is difficult to overcome.

Embarking on a professional retraining at fifty can, on the contrary, be a wonderful opportunity to change paths and flourish again in one's missions.

And then as Oscar Wilde said so well, "Better to have remorse than regret".

The fear of failure

The fear of failure can invade us, regardless of our age. If you have thought about your next professional project and all the signs are green, do not let your fears take control of your life. Try your luck in a professional adventure more suited to your values ​​and your current needs.

The lack of trust

It can be difficult to put yourself in the shoes of a job seeker after a smooth career. The impostor syndrome can quickly set in and make you lose confidence in yourself in the face of young recruits who you consider more in their place in the current world of work.

Do not let yourself be sucked into the spiral of doubt and think, on the contrary, of all that you can bring thanks to the solidity of your skills and the reliability of your profile. Because yes, recruiting a 50-year-old experienced person brings its share of advantages for a company.

Thanks to all these elements, the jobs_that_makesense team hopes that you now have all the material you need to best advance your professional project! And remember that age is just a number! It doesn't define you.

headline: Seeking IKIGAI
author: Marianne Roussel
description: Have you always dreamed of getting paid to do what you love? But are you really good at it, and is it really what the world needs? If you can answer yes to all of these questions, congratulations! You have found your Ikigai. If not, read this article urgently!
articleBody:
The 4 components of IKIGAI

How to make your Ikigai? For each of the 4 components, here are some questions to ask yourself to identify what contributes to your development. You can take a paper and a pencil to answer them. This is your moment of introspection:

What you love

In your current professional life, do you like what you do? What do you like about what you do at your workplace?

What activities make you happy at work? What are you doing when, so absorbed in what you're doing, you can't see the time passing?

If you have a new professional project, what makes you want to do this job?

You can also dive into the experiences of your professional career or your free time to ask yourself these questions, and even go back further on what would make you happy when you were a child.

Here is an example about me: When I write this article on Ikigai, I explore for 2/3 hours the resources that exist on the subject to take what seems to me the most relevant for this article. I like to do this work of research, of exploration.

A counterexample: When I spent days on prospecting files when I was a salesperson, I did not see the time passing. I was busy thinking about doing this task out of duty and to do my numbers at the end of the month. I put a lot of pressure on myself and found no job satisfaction.

What you're good at

Feeling useful is also a factor of fulfillment and commitment at work. When do you get positive feedback at work or in your personal life? What services are you called upon for?

Even if comparing yourself is not always the best option, it can be interesting to do it here: what do you do easily that is more difficult for others to do?

An example about me: I have no trouble meeting new people. I enjoy interviewing new people and at the same time I do it easily compared to others.

What the world needs

The meaning of work also contributes to job satisfaction. It is different for everyone and depends on our personality traits and values. The vision of what the world needs is therefore not the same for everyone.

What has been important to you in your professional career? What are the current issues that affect you? What are your emotional feelings towards them?

How can you integrate what the world needs into your work environment?

In the context of a professional reorientation, what are the professions, the structures which for you meet these needs?

About me: I write for jobs_that_makesense on topics of career guidance and impact at work. Many people want to give more meaning to their work by moving towards the world of impact and seek information to define or build a professional project.

What you can be paid for

Are you paid for what you love to do?

How much do you need to live as you wish?

Like the other components, it should not be privileged, otherwise there is no balance. Finding your Ikigai means understanding your personal balance thanks to these 4 elements to define a coherent professional project.

Some advices to use this method

Ikigai is presented as a method to help you get to know yourself better and find your professional vocation. The answers are not especially to be taken at face value. If you do online tests in particular, keep a step back on the answers they give you. Self-knowledge takes time, and Ikigai, like other tools, should be taken as nudges to support you in your personal development and guide you towards the job that suits you. Ultimately, it is above all your approach of asking yourself and undertaking a reflection on yourself that will allow you to move forward.
Don't be in too much of a rush to find results. If you don't find answers right away, repeat the exercise, for example by doing small regular check-ups at the end of your days. :)
Finding your professional path today via IKIGAI does not mean that you have found a path for life. This is an exercise that you can repeat regularly, because you change and so do your needs.

headline: 16 steps for a purpose-driven career change
author: Noëmie Martin-Pascual
description: There is no magic recipe for a successful professional retraining, but there are tools to prepare it well! Noëmie Martin-Pascual, founder of Bloom'r and Ways to shift, presents 16 key stages in this journey.
articleBody:
The big question when thinking about a professional change is of course: concretely, where to go?

A good knowledge of oneself and one's aspirations provides valuable elements to guide one's exploration and make one's choices.

Finding leads is not always easy, however.

10- Understand the needs of the world

To direct you to a job with an impact, your desires, your strengths, your centers of interest are of course decisive criteria for setting your professional course, but if you want to have a truly positive impact and in tune with the needs of the world, Understanding them well is an essential step.

A few questions to ask yourself:

In relation to the impact and contribution you want to have, what are the needs in terms of skills and employment?
What is being done today to tackle the issues that are important to you? What could be done more or differently?
It may be a good idea to zoom in on your territory. What issues related to ecological and social transition are specific to your area?

11- Open your horizons

As we know, it is very difficult to broaden one's horizons beyond the known, to bring out paths very far removed from one's daily life, one's entourage or from what one is used to hearing in the media or culture.

I advise you to :

Provoke encounters, especially with people you are not used to seeing. Ask them about their job, their daily life, their challenges. Use your close network, dare to contact strangers on Linkedin, attend fairs, networking events, associations...
Get inspired by testimonials found in the media via podcasts, shows or even films

The idea is to raise the antennas to capture everything you can around you, without filtering at first, taking what comes and what it inspires you.

Over time, you will collect ideas for professions, sectors, fields that appeal to you or seem aligned with what you are looking for.

This can be a radically different track from what you have done so far, such as an idea of ​​internal mobility in your company, a side project, an activity in addition to what you already do (slashing), or an entrepreneurial project. , a change of organization, or the transition from salaried to freelance…

Write down everything, everything, everything that crosses your mind.

12- Sort out your ideas

When you have lots of ideas, lots of desires: how to sort them, decide between them and choose?

To evaluate the different ideas, you need to dig into:

Your understanding of the business and the sector. For this, nothing beats a good business survey to discuss with professionals.
Opportunities, by zooming in on the areas that interest you. Who recruits ? What type of position? In what conditions ?
The feasibility of each project. In relation to your current skills, training, etc. what do you need to make this project a reality? Are you able to get it? In what time frame? Averaging ? Is this acceptable for you?
The financial implication of this reconversion: how can you finance it? what does this imply ? What devices or assistance do you have access to to help you cover the financial cost of this retraining?
The adequacy between your project and your desires, your constraints, your priorities, your strengths… Particular focus on the entourage: what are the potential consequences of this project on your personal and family life?
The attractiveness of the project: how much does the prospect of this project inspire you and make you want to? What do you like, attract you? What makes you doubt?
